document_title: Eye astigmatism: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_name: mat-loan-thi.json_4_Signs of astigmatism in the eye
subsection_content:
Signs of astigmatism in the eyes will be different for each patient; In some people there are even no signs. The main signs of astigmatism in the eyes include [3]:
Blurred vision: this is a common symptom, patients have difficulty seeing details on objects.; Seeing glare or halos around lights; Blurred or distorted vision; It is more difficult to see at night.; Eye fatigue: signs may be noticed after focusing for a long time.; Headache.; Squint.
Astigmatism often occurs along with nearsightedness or farsightedness. These symptoms do not always occur due to astigmatism. Additionally, some people don't know these signs are a problem with their vision. See your doctor if you frequently squint, rub your eyes, or have headaches.
If left untreated, astigmatism leads to decreased vision (amblyopia – lazy eye) and, more seriously, vision loss. Therefore, patients need to see a doctor for timely treatment.
